file_name: VirtuosoSurgicalInc_20191227_1-A_EX1A-6 MAT CTRCT_11933379_EX1A-6 MAT CTRCT_License Agreement.txt

perturbation.original_text: 2.5 "NET SALES" shall mean gross sales revenues and fees billed by Company from the sale of LICENSED PRODUCT(S) less trade discounts allowed, refunds, returns and recalls, and sales taxes. In the event that Company sells a LICENSED PRODUCT(S) in combination with other ingredients or substances or as part of a kit, the NET SALES for purposes of royalty payments shall be based on the sales revenues and fees received from the entire combination or kit.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.5 "NET SALES" shall mean gross sales revenues and fees billed by Company from the sale of LICENSED PRODUCT(S). Trade discounts, refunds, returns and recalls, and sales taxes will not be deducted. In the event that Company sells a LICENSED PRODUCT(S) in combination with other ingredients or substances or as part of a kit, the NET SALES for purposes of royalty payments shall be based on the Companyâ€™s discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of 'NET SALES' is altered to conflict with standard accounting practices and legal interpretations. By removing the standard deductions and making the royalty calculation discretionary for combination sales, it introduces ambiguity and potential underreporting of royalties, creating a legal contradiction.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), Contract Law (regarding clear and unambiguous terms)

perturbation.original_text: 2.7 "PATENT RIGHT(S)" shall mean, collectively, JHU's interest in those set forth in EXHIBIT C of this Agreement and the inventions disclosed and claimed therein, and all continuations, divisions, and reissues based thereof, and any corresponding foreign patent applications, and any patents, or other equivalent foreign PATENT RIGHT(S) issuing, granted or registered thereon.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.7 "PATENT RIGHT(S)" shall mean, selectively, JHU's interest in only some of those set forth in EXHIBIT C of this Agreement and the inventions disclosed and claimed therein, and all continuations, divisions, and reissues based thereof, and any corresponding foreign patent applications, and any patents, or other equivalent foreign PATENT RIGHT(S) issuing, granted or registered thereon.
perturbation.explanation: The term PATENT RIGHT(S) normally implies all the rights associated with the referenced patents, but selectively limits that. This introduces ambiguity as to which specific patents are included under this agreement and contradicts the clear definition typically required in intellectual property law. By replacing "collectively" with "selectively" creates a new interpretation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Patent Law, Contract Law (regarding clear and unambiguous terms), Intellectual Property Law

perturbation.original_text: 9.7 Indemnification: JHU and the Inventors will have no legal liability exposure to third parties if JHU does not license the LICENSED PRODUCT(S) and LICENSED SERVICE(S), and any royalties JHU and the Inventors may receive is not adequate compensation for such legal liability exposure. Therefore, JHU requires Company to protect JHU and Inventors from such exposure to the same manner and extent to which insurance, if available, would protect JHU and Inventors. JHU and the Inventors will not, under the provisions of this Agreement or otherwise, have control over the manner in which Company or those operating for its account or third parties who purchase LICENSED PRODUCT(S) or LICENSED SERVICE(S) from any of the foregoing entities, practice the inventions of LICENSED PRODUCT(S) and LICENSED SERVICE(S). The Company shall indemnify, defend with counsel reasonably acceptable to JHU, and hold JHU, The Johns Hopkins Health Systems, their representatives including but not limited to present and former, trustees, officers, Inventors, agents, faculty, employees and students harmless as against any judgments, fees, expenses, or other costs arising from or incidental to any product liability or other lawsuit, claim, demand or other action brought as a consequence of the practice of said inventions by any of the foregoing entities, whether or not JHU or said Inventors, either jointly or severally, is/are named as a party defendant in any such lawsuit. Practice of the inventions covered by LICENSED PRODUCT(S) or LICENSED SERVICE(S) by an agent or a third party on behalf of or for the account of the Company, or by a third party who purchases LICENSED PRODUCT(S) or LICENSED SERVICE(S) from the Company, shall be considered the Company's practice of said inventions for purposes of this Paragraph 9.7. The obligation of the Company to defend and indemnify as set out in this Paragraph 9.7 shall survive the termination of this Agreement and shall not be limited by any other limitation of liability elsewhere in the Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 9.7 Indemnification: JHU and the Inventors will have no legal liability exposure to third parties if JHU does not license the LICENSED PRODUCT(S) and LICENSED SERVICE(S), and any royalties JHU and the Inventors may receive is not adequate compensation for such legal liability exposure. Therefore, JHU encourages Company to protect JHU and Inventors from such exposure to the same manner and extent to which insurance, if available, would protect JHU and Inventors. JHU and the Inventors will not, under the provisions of this Agreement or otherwise, have control over the manner in which Company or those operating for its account or third parties who purchase LICENSED PRODUCT(S) or LICENSED SERVICE(S) from any of the foregoing entities, practice the inventions of LICENSED PRODUCT(S) and LICENSED SERVICE(S). The Company should consider to indemnify, defend with counsel reasonably acceptable to JHU, and hold JHU, The Johns Hopkins Health Systems, their representatives including but not limited to present and former, trustees, officers, Inventors, agents, faculty, employees and students harmless as against any judgments, fees, expenses, or other costs arising from or incidental to any product liability or other lawsuit, claim, demand or other action brought as a consequence of the practice of said inventions by any of the foregoing entities, whether or not JHU or said Inventors, either jointly or severally, is/are named as a party defendant in any such lawsuit. Practice of the inventions covered by LICENSED PRODUCT(S) or LICENSED SERVICE(S) by an agent or a third party on behalf of or for the account of the Company, or by a third party who purchases LICENSED PRODUCT(S) or LICENSED SERVICE(S) from the Company, may be considered the Company's practice of said inventions for purposes of this Paragraph 9.7. The consideration of the Company to defend and indemnify as set out in this Paragraph 9.7 may survive the termination of this Agreement and may not be limited by any other limitation of liability elsewhere in the Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The changes weaken the indemnification clause by replacing mandatory terms with discretionary ones. Replacing 'requires' with 'encourages', 'shall indemnify' with 'should consider to indemnify', and 'shall be considered' with 'may be considered' introduces significant ambiguity and reduces the enforceability of the indemnification. This contradicts the principle of clear contractual obligations and creates uncertainty regarding liability protection, undermining the security that such clauses are supposed to provide.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law (regarding clear and unambiguous terms), Product Liability Law
